5#ifndef V8_HEAP_BASE_BASIC_SLOT_SET_H_
6#define V8_HEAP_BASE_BASIC_SLOT_SET_H_
7
8#include <cstddef>
9#include <memory>
10
11#include "src/base/atomic-utils.h"
12#include "src/base/bits.h"
13#include "src/base/platform/memory.h"
14
15namespace heap {
16namespace base {
17
18enum SlotCallbackResult { KEEP_SLOT, REMOVE_SLOT };
19
20// Data structure for maintaining a set of slots in a standard (non-large)
21// page.
22// The data structure assumes that the slots are pointer size aligned and
23// splits the valid slot offset range into buckets.
24// Each bucket is a bitmap with a bit corresponding to a single slot offset.
25template <size_t SlotGranularity>
26class BasicSlotSet {
27 static constexpr auto kSystemPointerSize = sizeof(void*);
28
29 public:
30 using Address = uintptr_t;
31
32 enum AccessMode : uint8_t {
33 ATOMIC,
34 NON_ATOMIC,
35 };
36
37 enum EmptyBucketMode {
38 FREE_EMPTY_BUCKETS, // An empty bucket will be deallocated immediately.
39 KEEP_EMPTY_BUCKETS // An empty bucket will be kept.
40 };
41
42 BasicSlotSet() = delete;
43
44 static BasicSlotSet* Allocate(size_t buckets) {
45 // BasicSlotSet* slot_set --+
46 // |
47 // v
48 // +-----------------+-------------------------+
49 // | initial buckets | buckets array |
50 // +-----------------+-------------------------+
51 // pointer-sized pointer-sized * buckets
52 //
53 //
54 // The BasicSlotSet pointer points to the beginning of the buckets array for
55 // faster access in the write barrier. The number of buckets is needed for
56 // calculating the size of this data structure.
57 size_t buckets_size = buckets * sizeof(Bucket*);
58 size_t size = kInitialBucketsSize + buckets_size;
59 void* allocation = v8::base::AlignedAlloc(size, kSystemPointerSize);
60 CHECK(allocation);
61 BasicSlotSet* slot_set = reinterpret_cast<BasicSlotSet*>(
62 reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(allocation) + kInitialBucketsSize);
63 DCHECK(
64 IsAligned(reinterpret_cast<uintptr_t>(slot_set), kSystemPointerSize));
65#ifdef DEBUG
66 *slot_set->initial_buckets() = buckets;
67#endif
68 for (size_t i = 0; i < buckets; i++) {
69 *slot_set->bucket(i) = nullptr;
70 }
71 return slot_set;
72 }
73
74 static void Delete(BasicSlotSet* slot_set, size_t buckets) {
75 if (slot_set == nullptr) return;
76
77 for (size_t i = 0; i < buckets; i++) {
78 slot_set->ReleaseBucket(i);
79 }
80
81#ifdef DEBUG
82 size_t initial_buckets = *slot_set->initial_buckets();
83
84 for (size_t i = buckets; i < initial_buckets; i++) {
85 DCHECK_NULL(*slot_set->bucket(i));
86 }
87#endif
88
89 v8::base::AlignedFree(reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(slot_set) -
90 kInitialBucketsSize);
91 }
92
93 constexpr static size_t BucketsForSize(size_t size) {
94 return (size + (SlotGranularity * kBitsPerBucket) - 1) /
95 (SlotGranularity * kBitsPerBucket);
96 }
97
98 // Converts the slot offset into bucket index.
99 constexpr static size_t BucketForSlot(size_t slot_offset) {
100 DCHECK(IsAligned(slot_offset, SlotGranularity));
101 return slot_offset / (SlotGranularity * kBitsPerBucket);
102 }
103
104 // Converts bucket index into slot offset.
105 constexpr static size_t OffsetForBucket(size_t bucket_index) {
106 return bucket_index * SlotGranularity * kBitsPerBucket;
107 }
108
109 // The slot offset specifies a slot at address page_start_ + slot_offset.
110 // AccessMode defines whether there can be concurrent access on the buckets
111 // or not.
112 template <AccessMode access_mode>
113 void Insert(size_t slot_offset) {
114 size_t bucket_index;
115 int cell_index, bit_index;
116 SlotToIndices(slot_offset, &bucket_index, &cell_index, &bit_index);
117 Bucket* bucket = LoadBucket<access_mode>(bucket_index);
118 if (bucket == nullptr) {
119 bucket = new Bucket;
120 if (!SwapInNewBucket<access_mode>(bucket_index, bucket)) {
121 delete bucket;
122 bucket = LoadBucket<access_mode>(bucket_index);
123 }
124 }
125 // Check that monotonicity is preserved, i.e., once a bucket is set we do
126 // not free it concurrently.
127 DCHECK(bucket != nullptr);
128 DCHECK_EQ(bucket->cells(), LoadBucket<access_mode>(bucket_index)->cells());
129 uint32_t mask = 1u << bit_index;
130 if ((bucket->template LoadCell<access_mode>(cell_index) & mask) == 0) {
131 bucket->template SetCellBits<access_mode>(cell_index, mask);
132 }
133 }
134
135 // The slot offset specifies a slot at address page_start_ + slot_offset.
136 // Returns true if the set contains the slot.
137 bool Contains(size_t slot_offset) {
138 size_t bucket_index;
139 int cell_index, bit_index;
140 SlotToIndices(slot_offset, &bucket_index, &cell_index, &bit_index);
141 Bucket* bucket = LoadBucket(bucket_index);
142 if (bucket == nullptr) return false;
143 return (bucket->LoadCell(cell_index) & (1u << bit_index)) != 0;
144 }
145
146 // The slot offset specifies a slot at address page_start_ + slot_offset.
147 void Remove(size_t slot_offset) {
148 size_t bucket_index;
149 int cell_index, bit_index;
150 SlotToIndices(slot_offset, &bucket_index, &cell_index, &bit_index);
151 Bucket* bucket = LoadBucket(bucket_index);
152 if (bucket != nullptr) {
153 uint32_t cell = bucket->LoadCell(cell_index);
154 uint32_t bit_mask = 1u << bit_index;
155 if (cell & bit_mask) {
156 bucket->ClearCellBits(cell_index, bit_mask);
157 }
158 }
159 }
160
161 // The slot offsets specify a range of slots at addresses:
162 // [page_start_ + start_offset ... page_start_ + end_offset).
163 void RemoveRange(size_t start_offset, size_t end_offset, size_t buckets,
164 EmptyBucketMode mode) {
165 CHECK_LE(end_offset, buckets * kBitsPerBucket * SlotGranularity);
166 DCHECK_LE(start_offset, end_offset);
167 size_t start_bucket;
168 int start_cell, start_bit;
169 SlotToIndices(start_offset, &start_bucket, &start_cell, &start_bit);
170 size_t end_bucket;
171 int end_cell, end_bit;
172 SlotToIndices(end_offset, &end_bucket, &end_cell, &end_bit);
173 uint32_t start_mask = (1u << start_bit) - 1;
174 uint32_t end_mask = ~((1u << end_bit) - 1);
175 Bucket* bucket;
176 if (start_bucket == end_bucket && start_cell == end_cell) {
177 bucket = LoadBucket(start_bucket);
178 if (bucket != nullptr) {
179 bucket->ClearCellBits(start_cell, ~(start_mask | end_mask));
180 }
181 return;
182 }
183 size_t current_bucket = start_bucket;
184 int current_cell = start_cell;
185 bucket = LoadBucket(current_bucket);
186 if (bucket != nullptr) {
187 bucket->ClearCellBits(current_cell, ~start_mask);
188 }
189 current_cell++;
190 if (current_bucket < end_bucket) {
191 if (bucket != nullptr) {
192 ClearBucket(bucket, current_cell, kCellsPerBucket);
193 }
194 // The rest of the current bucket is cleared.
195 // Move on to the next bucket.
196 current_bucket++;
197 current_cell = 0;
198 }
199 DCHECK(current_bucket == end_bucket ||
200 (current_bucket < end_bucket && current_cell == 0));
201 while (current_bucket < end_bucket) {
202 if (mode == FREE_EMPTY_BUCKETS) {
203 ReleaseBucket(current_bucket);
204 } else {
205 DCHECK(mode == KEEP_EMPTY_BUCKETS);
206 bucket = LoadBucket(current_bucket);
207 if (bucket != nullptr) {
208 ClearBucket(bucket, 0, kCellsPerBucket);
209 }
210 }
211 current_bucket++;
212 }
213 // All buckets between start_bucket and end_bucket are cleared.
214 DCHECK(current_bucket == end_bucket);
215 if (current_bucket == buckets) return;
216 bucket = LoadBucket(current_bucket);
217 DCHECK(current_cell <= end_cell);
218 if (bucket == nullptr) return;
219 while (current_cell < end_cell) {
220 bucket->StoreCell(current_cell, 0);
221 current_cell++;
222 }
223 // All cells between start_cell and end_cell are cleared.
224 DCHECK(current_bucket == end_bucket && current_cell == end_cell);
225 bucket->ClearCellBits(end_cell, ~end_mask);
226 }
227
228 // The slot offset specifies a slot at address page_start_ + slot_offset.
229 bool Lookup(size_t slot_offset) {
230 size_t bucket_index;
231 int cell_index, bit_index;
232 SlotToIndices(slot_offset, &bucket_index, &cell_index, &bit_index);
233 Bucket* bucket = LoadBucket(bucket_index);
234 if (bucket == nullptr) return false;
235 return (bucket->LoadCell(cell_index) & (1u << bit_index)) != 0;
236 }
237
238 // Iterate over all slots in the set and for each slot invoke the callback.
239 // If the callback returns REMOVE_SLOT then the slot is removed from the set.
240 // Returns the new number of slots.
241 //
242 // Iteration can be performed concurrently with other operations that use
243 // atomic access mode such as insertion and removal. However there is no
244 // guarantee about ordering and linearizability.
245 //
246 // Sample usage:
247 // Iterate([](Address slot) {
248 // if (good(slot)) return KEEP_SLOT;
249 // else return REMOVE_SLOT;
250 // });
251 //
252 // Releases memory for empty buckets with FREE_EMPTY_BUCKETS.
253 template <AccessMode access_mode = AccessMode::ATOMIC, typename Callback>
254 size_t Iterate(Address chunk_start, size_t start_bucket, size_t end_bucket,
255 Callback callback, EmptyBucketMode mode) {
256 return Iterate<access_mode>(
257 chunk_start, start_bucket, end_bucket, callback,
258 [this, mode](size_t bucket_index) {
259 if (mode == EmptyBucketMode::FREE_EMPTY_BUCKETS) {
260 ReleaseBucket(bucket_index);
261 }
262 });
263 }
264
265 static constexpr int kCellsPerBucket = 32;
266 static constexpr int kCellsPerBucketLog2 = 5;
267 static constexpr int kCellSizeBytesLog2 = 2;
268 static constexpr int kCellSizeBytes = 1 << kCellSizeBytesLog2;
269 static constexpr int kBitsPerCell = 32;
270 static constexpr int kBitsPerCellLog2 = 5;
271 static constexpr int kBitsPerBucket = kCellsPerBucket * kBitsPerCell;
272 static constexpr int kBitsPerBucketLog2 =
273 kCellsPerBucketLog2 + kBitsPerCellLog2;
274
275 class Bucket final {
276 uint32_t cells_[kCellsPerBucket];
277
278 public:
279 Bucket() {
280 for (int i = 0; i < kCellsPerBucket; i++) {
281 cells_[i] = 0;
282 }
283 }
284
285 uint32_t* cells() { return cells_; }
286 const uint32_t* cells() const { return cells_; }
287 uint32_t* cell(int cell_index) { return cells_ + cell_index; }
288 const uint32_t* cell(int cell_index) const { return cells_ + cell_index; }
289
290 template <AccessMode access_mode = AccessMode::ATOMIC>
291 uint32_t LoadCell(int cell_index) {
292 DCHECK_LT(cell_index, kCellsPerBucket);
293 if constexpr (access_mode == AccessMode::ATOMIC)
294 return v8::base::AsAtomic32::Acquire_Load(cell(cell_index));
295 return *(cell(cell_index));
296 }
297
298 template <AccessMode access_mode = AccessMode::ATOMIC>
299 void SetCellBits(int cell_index, uint32_t mask) {
300 if constexpr (access_mode == AccessMode::ATOMIC) {
301 v8::base::AsAtomic32::SetBits(cell(cell_index), mask, mask);
302 } else {
303 uint32_t* c = cell(cell_index);
304 *c = (*c & ~mask) | mask;
305 }
306 }
307
308 template <AccessMode access_mode = AccessMode::ATOMIC>
309 void ClearCellBits(int cell_index, uint32_t mask) {
310 if constexpr (access_mode == AccessMode::ATOMIC) {
311 v8::base::AsAtomic32::SetBits(cell(cell_index), 0u, mask);
312 } else {
313 *cell(cell_index) &= ~mask;
314 }
315 }
316
317 void StoreCell(int cell_index, uint32_t value) {
318 v8::base::AsAtomic32::Release_Store(cell(cell_index), value);
319 }
320
321 bool IsEmpty() const {
322 for (int i = 0; i < kCellsPerBucket; i++) {
323 if (cells_[i] != 0) {
324 return false;
325 }
326 }
327 return true;
328 }
329 };
330
331 protected:
332 template <AccessMode access_mode = AccessMode::ATOMIC, typename Callback,
333 typename EmptyBucketCallback>
334 size_t Iterate(Address chunk_start, size_t start_bucket, size_t end_bucket,
335 Callback callback, EmptyBucketCallback empty_bucket_callback) {
336 size_t new_count = 0;
337 for (size_t bucket_index = start_bucket; bucket_index < end_bucket;
338 bucket_index++) {
339 Bucket* bucket = LoadBucket<access_mode>(bucket_index);
340 if (bucket != nullptr) {
341 size_t in_bucket_count = 0;
342 size_t cell_offset = bucket_index << kBitsPerBucketLog2;
343 for (int i = 0; i < kCellsPerBucket; i++, cell_offset += kBitsPerCell) {
344 uint32_t cell = bucket->template LoadCell<access_mode>(i);
345 if (cell) {
346 uint32_t old_cell = cell;
347 uint32_t mask = 0;
348 while (cell) {
349 int bit_offset = v8::base::bits::CountTrailingZeros(cell);
350 uint32_t bit_mask = 1u << bit_offset;
351 Address slot = (cell_offset + bit_offset) * SlotGranularity;
352 if (callback(chunk_start + slot) == KEEP_SLOT) {
353 ++in_bucket_count;
354 } else {
355 mask |= bit_mask;
356 }
357 cell ^= bit_mask;
358 }
359 uint32_t new_cell = old_cell & ~mask;
360 if (old_cell != new_cell) {
361 bucket->template ClearCellBits<access_mode>(i, mask);
362 }
363 }
364 }
365 if (in_bucket_count == 0) {
366 empty_bucket_callback(bucket_index);
367 }
368 new_count += in_bucket_count;
369 }
370 }
371 return new_count;
372 }
373
374 bool FreeBucketIfEmpty(size_t bucket_index) {
375 Bucket* bucket = LoadBucket<AccessMode::NON_ATOMIC>(bucket_index);
376 if (bucket != nullptr) {
377 if (bucket->IsEmpty()) {
378 ReleaseBucket<AccessMode::NON_ATOMIC>(bucket_index);
379 } else {
380 return false;
381 }
382 }
383
384 return true;
385 }
386
387 void ClearBucket(Bucket* bucket, int start_cell, int end_cell) {
388 DCHECK_GE(start_cell, 0);
389 DCHECK_LE(end_cell, kCellsPerBucket);
390 int current_cell = start_cell;
391 while (current_cell < kCellsPerBucket) {
392 bucket->StoreCell(current_cell, 0);
393 current_cell++;
394 }
395 }
396
397 template <AccessMode access_mode = AccessMode::ATOMIC>
398 void ReleaseBucket(size_t bucket_index) {
399 Bucket* bucket = LoadBucket<access_mode>(bucket_index);
400 StoreBucket<access_mode>(bucket_index, nullptr);
401 delete bucket;
402 }
403
404 template <AccessMode access_mode = AccessMode::ATOMIC>
405 Bucket* LoadBucket(Bucket** bucket) {
406 if (access_mode == AccessMode::ATOMIC)
407 return v8::base::AsAtomicPointer::Acquire_Load(bucket);
408 return *bucket;
409 }
410
411 template <AccessMode access_mode = AccessMode::ATOMIC>
412 Bucket* LoadBucket(size_t bucket_index) {
413 return LoadBucket(bucket(bucket_index));
414 }
415
416 template <AccessMode access_mode = AccessMode::ATOMIC>
417 void StoreBucket(Bucket** bucket, Bucket* value) {
418 if (access_mode == AccessMode::ATOMIC) {
419 v8::base::AsAtomicPointer::Release_Store(bucket, value);
420 } else {
421 *bucket = value;
422 }
423 }
424
425 template <AccessMode access_mode = AccessMode::ATOMIC>
426 void StoreBucket(size_t bucket_index, Bucket* value) {
427 StoreBucket(bucket(bucket_index), value);
428 }
429
430 template <AccessMode access_mode = AccessMode::ATOMIC>
431 bool SwapInNewBucket(size_t bucket_index, Bucket* value) {
432 Bucket** b = bucket(bucket_index);
433 if (access_mode == AccessMode::ATOMIC) {
434 return v8::base::AsAtomicPointer::Release_CompareAndSwap(
435 b, nullptr, value) == nullptr;
436 } else {
437 DCHECK_NULL(*b);
438 *b = value;
439 return true;
440 }
441 }
442
443 // Converts the slot offset into bucket/cell/bit index.
444 static void SlotToIndices(size_t slot_offset, size_t* bucket_index,
445 int* cell_index, int* bit_index) {
446 DCHECK(IsAligned(slot_offset, SlotGranularity));
447 size_t slot = slot_offset / SlotGranularity;
448 *bucket_index = slot >> kBitsPerBucketLog2;
449 *cell_index =
450 static_cast<int>((slot >> kBitsPerCellLog2) & (kCellsPerBucket - 1));
451 *bit_index = static_cast<int>(slot & (kBitsPerCell - 1));
452 }
453
454 Bucket** buckets() { return reinterpret_cast<Bucket**>(this); }
455 Bucket** bucket(size_t bucket_index) { return buckets() + bucket_index; }
456
457#ifdef DEBUG
458 size_t* initial_buckets() { return reinterpret_cast<size_t*>(this) - 1; }
459 static const int kInitialBucketsSize = sizeof(size_t);
460#else
461 static const int kInitialBucketsSize = 0;
462#endif
463};
464
465} // namespace base
466} // namespace heap
467
468#endif // V8_HEAP_BASE_BASIC_SLOT_SET_H_
